name: Chicken Tempura (Toriten)
description: Chicken Tempura is a regional favorite in Oita Prefecture of Kyushu region in Japan. With a crispy and fluffy batter on the outside and juicy and tender meat inside, this Chicken Tempura is best enjoyed by dipping with karashi mustard ponzu sauce.

video.description:
Chicken Tempura is a regional favorite in Oita Prefecture of Kyushu region in Japan. With a crispy and fluffy batter on the outside and juicy and tender meat inside, this Chicken Tempura is best enjoyed by dipping with karashi mustard ponzu sauce.

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 00:28

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/ChickenTempuraRecipe

Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hr 15 mins
Servings: 6-8
 
Ingredients:

¬æ lb chicken breast (320 g)
1 knob ginger
1 clove garlic
Freshly ground black pepper
Kosher salt
1 tsp sake
2 tsp soy sauce
1 large egg
1/3 cup cake flour (45 g)
1/3 cup potato/ cornstarch (55 g)
1/3 cup water (75 ml)
3-4 cups deep fry oil (700-950 ml)

To serve:
Ponzu sauce
Japanese Karashi hot mustard

Instructions with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/ChickenTempuraRecipe


‚òÖ FOLLOW JUST ONE COOKBOOK ‚òÖ

recipeIngredient: 1  large egg (50 g each w/o shell)

recipeInstructions.text: Before You Start: I highly encourage you to weigh your ingredients using a¬†kitchen scale¬†for this recipe. Click on the ‚ÄúMetric‚Äú button at the top of the recipe to convert the ingredient measurements to metric. If you‚Äòre using a cup measurement, please follow the ‚Äúfluff and sprinkle‚Äú method: Fluff your flour with a spoon, sprinkle the flour into your measuring cup, and level it off. Otherwise, you may scoop more flour than you need.
recipeInstructions.name: Before You Start: I highly encourage you to weigh your ingredients using a¬†kitchen scale¬†for this recipe. Click on the ‚ÄúMetric‚Äú button at the top of the recipe to convert the ingredient measurements to metric. If you‚Äòre using a cup measurement, please follow the ‚Äúfluff and sprinkle‚Äú method: Fluff your flour with a spoon, sprinkle the flour into your measuring cup, and level it off. Otherwise, you may scoop more flour than you need.

itemListElement.text: Pound ¬æ lb boneless, skinless chicken breast with a meat tenderizer. If you don‚Äôt own one, you can use the back of the knife. This helps to yield a thinner and flatter piece of meat, so the meat cooks faster and more evenly (with no more overcooking!)
itemListElement.name: Pound ¬æ lb boneless, skinless chicken breast with a meat tenderizer. If you don‚Äôt own one, you can use the back of the knife. This helps to yield a thinner and flatter piece of meat, so the meat cooks faster and more evenly (with no more overcooking!)

itemListElement.text: Cut the meat into strips roughly ¬æ inch (2 cm) wide and 3 inches (7.5 cm) long.
itemListElement.name: Cut the meat into strips roughly ¬æ inch (2 cm) wide and 3 inches (7.5 cm) long.

itemListElement.text: Grate 1 knob  ginger (I use a ceramic grater) and 1 clove garlic.
itemListElement.name: Grate 1 knob  ginger (I use a ceramic grater) and 1 clove garlic.

itemListElement.text: Season the chicken with freshly ground black pepper,¬†¬º tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt, 1 tsp sake, and 2 tsp soy sauce.
itemListElement.name: Season the chicken with freshly ground black pepper,¬†¬º tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt, 1 tsp sake, and 2 tsp soy sauce.

itemListElement.text: Add the grated ginger and garlic and mix well with your hands to rub the chicken with the seasonings.
itemListElement.name: Add the grated ginger and garlic and mix well with your hands to rub the chicken with the seasonings.

itemListElement.text: Set a medium bowl over a large bowl with ice water in it. Add 1 large egg (50 g each w/o shell) and whisk well.
itemListElement.name: Set a medium bowl over a large bowl with ice water in it. Add 1 large egg (50 g each w/o shell) and whisk well.

itemListElement.text: With a fine-mesh sieve, sift ‚Öì cup cake flour and ‚Öì cup potato starch or cornstarch into the bowl with the egg.
itemListElement.name: With a fine-mesh sieve, sift ‚Öì cup cake flour and ‚Öì cup potato starch or cornstarch into the bowl with the egg.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add ‚Öì cup water and mix it all together until just combined (don‚Äôt overmix).
itemListElement.name: Gradually add ‚Öì cup water and mix it all together until just combined (don‚Äôt overmix).

itemListElement.text: Add the chicken pieces and coat well with the batter.
itemListElement.name: Add the chicken pieces and coat well with the batter.

itemListElement.text: Heat 3‚Äì4 cups (720-960 ml) neutral oil to 350¬∫F (180¬∫C) in a deep fryer (or in a medium-size pot). Add in only 2‚Äì3 pieces of battered chicken at one time. To prevent the temperature of the oil from decreasing, do not add too many cold chicken pieces at once. Deep-fry each batch until crispy on the outside, about 4 minutes total, 2 minutes each side. Then, repeat with another 2‚Äì3 pieces, until all pieces are cooked. Between batches, scoop up the tempura crumbs in the oil to keep your oil clean.
itemListElement.name: Heat 3‚Äì4 cups (720-960 ml) neutral oil to 350¬∫F (180¬∫C) in a deep fryer (or in a medium-size pot). Add in only 2‚Äì3 pieces of battered chicken at one time. To prevent the temperature of the oil from decreasing, do not add too many cold chicken pieces at once. Deep-fry each batch until crispy on the outside, about 4 minutes total, 2 minutes each side. Then, repeat with another 2‚Äì3 pieces, until all pieces are cooked. Between batches, scoop up the tempura crumbs in the oil to keep your oil clean.

itemListElement.text: Serve the Chicken Tempura with shredded cabbage (I use a cabbage slicer that yields thinly shredded cabbage) and ponzu with Japanese Karashi hot mustard on the side.
itemListElement.name: Serve the Chicken Tempura with shredded cabbage (I use a cabbage slicer that yields thinly shredded cabbage) and ponzu with Japanese Karashi hot mustard on the side.

review.reviewBody:
Hi, Nami.

What's the difference between Toriten and Karaage? I still cannot figure it out.

Shuni

Finally,  I find the right ingredients and almost perfect ratio to make my own tempura. I usually use common 'fried chicken' recipe in every time I cook this menu,  the taste is quite good but the texture awaaaaaaaaaay different.  Thank you again for the recipe, moreover for the tips.  Keep your amazing hard work. ????
